name: Bilateral Acute Idiopathic Maculopathy (BAIM)
chief_complaint: Sudden blurry vision and central dark spots in both eyes
physical_findings: Bilateral macular edema with yellow-white lesions

lab_results.OCT: Subretinal hyperreflective material with neurosensory detachment

prognosis: Variable; 60% achieve 20/40 vision or better within 6 months, but may recur or develop CNV
description: A rare inflammatory disorder affecting the RPE and outer retina, typically affecting healthy young adults. Characterized by acute bilateral central vision loss with distinctive multimodal imaging findings. Etiology remains unknown but may represent a post-viral autoimmune response.
multiple_choice: Acute posterior multifocal placoid pigment epitheliopathy
